intro: Bellevalia sirnakensis, commonly known as the Sirnak bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the spring season. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
